alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued October 07 at 9:55PM CDT until October 08 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 to 37 degrees could result in frost formation. * WHERE...In Kansas, Smith and Jewell Counties. In Nebraska, Gosper, Phelps, Kearney, Furnas, Harlan, Franklin and Webster Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 9 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to a stubborn deck of clouds in place as of Friday evening, there is some uncertainty whether temperatures will get cold enough overnight to allow frost formation. If these clouds remain in place, frost will be less likely. However, if clouds manage to clear before sunrise, then temperatures could quickly drop and allow frost development.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
